==What to Check For==
Verify that code is obfuscated with //ProGuard//.
==Why==
Obfuscate the application binary with //ProGuard// to make it more difficult to reverse engineer.
==How to Check==
To verify that code is obfuscated with //ProGuard//:
# **Verify that //ProGuard// is configured.** # **Verify that //ProGuard// is enabled.** # **Verify that the application is built in release mode.**
==How to Fix==
To obfuscate code with //ProGuard//:
# **Configure //ProGuard//.** Edit the //proguard.cfg// file to suit your application. # **Enable //ProGuard//.** Change the //proguard.config// property in the //project.properties// file to point to the location of the //proguard.cfg// file. # **Enable release mode.** //ProGuard// is executed automatically by the Android build system when it is used to build applications in release mode. # **Build the application.** Build your application in release mode to obfuscate the binary with //ProGuard//.
==Additional Resources==
* For more information about //ProGuard//, please see http://developer.android.com/tools/help/proguard.html * For //ProGuard// documentation, please see http://proguard.sourceforge.net/manual/introduction.html
